markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=1480)
<actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Darkness" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=39" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 322 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** 20-foot burst

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a [torch](/Equipment.aspx?ID=60) or [lantern](/Equipment.aspx?ID=29), do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical [light](/Traits.aspx?ID=100) of your _darkness_ spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

---
**Heightened (4th)** Even creatures with [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=415) (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4).
name: Darkness

---

<summary>
Suppress all light in an area.
</summary>
summary: Suppress all light in an area.
summary_markdown: Suppress all light in an area.
text: Darkness Three Actions Source Player Core pg. 322 2.0 Traditions Arcane, Divine, Occult, Primal Range 120 feet Area 20-foot burst Duration 1 minute --- You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's rank or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness. --- Heightened (4th) Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as concealed.
